meanings.definition: In a manner that expresses dissatisfaction or annoyance
meanings.sent1: She spoke complainingly about the long line at the store.
meanings.sent2: He sighed complainingly when asked to do the dishes.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed complainingly when its food bowl was empty.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled complainingly through the cracks in the window.
meanings.sent5: The old door creaked complainingly every time it was opened.

meanings.definition: With a tone of discontent or grumbling
meanings.sent1: The child looked complainingly at the vegetables on his plate.
meanings.sent2: She muttered complainingly about the rainy weather.
meanings.sent3: The car engine sputtered complainingly before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: The clock ticked complainingly as if tired of marking time.
meanings.sent5: The branches swayed complainingly in the strong wind.
